sentences.sContent: Ten million voters went to the polls.
18% of the women we polled said their husbands had a drinking problem.
sentences.sCn: 我们调查的妇女当中有18%的人说丈夫有酗酒问题。

sentences.sContent: ...A 2002 poll by the National Sleep Foundation suggests that the average has fallen to under 7 hours...

synos.tran: 投票；民意测验；投票数；投票所
投票；剪短；对…进行民意测验；获得选票
无角的；剪过毛的；修过枝的

words.tran: 精明的；有策略的；狡猾的；审慎的

trans.tranOther: the process of voting in an election, or the number of votes recorded
to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject
